body: Can you update to the latest version and re-test please?

Didn't see any updates to the Seafile implementation between the versions, and I'm following the quarterly branch on FreeBSD hence the ~3 months old version. Anyways, built rclone from ports but still the same problems:

```
# rclone --version
rclone v1.61.1-DEV
- os/version: freebsd 13.1-release-p2 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 13.1-release-p2 (amd64)
- os/type: freebsd
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.19.4
- go/linking: dynamic
- go/tags: none
```

After exactly 1 hour files just stop transferring and I get the same error:

```
Jan  1 18:13:20 rclone rclone[22179]: xxx: Failed to copy: internal server error during file upload
Jan  1 18:13:23 rclone rclone[22179]: xxx: Failed to copy: internal server error during file upload
Jan  1 18:13:28 rclone rclone[22179]: xxx: Failed to copy: internal server error during file upload
```

We probably need to re-post the library key after an hour to reload the decryption key in the server. Either automatically some time before an hour or after the first error, assuming the server returns a specific error code (decryption error).

I'll have a look how it handles a re-post of the library key while a file is being transferred, otherwise we would need to pause any transfer momentarily üëéüèª

That's what I thought, the server returns a generic error üòû 

`DEBUG : pacer: low level retry 1/1 (error HTTP error 500 (500 Internal Server Error) returned body: "{\"error\": \"Internal error\n\"}")`

so it will need to be sent in the background after some time

Now for the good news, I've also tried to post the password every 10 seconds during a long copy of files and it worked fine üòÄ
:-) You want something like this https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/lib/oauthutil/renew.go which is the same solution for the oauth backends but with your own logic.

Cool, I had a similar draft implementation but I was wondering how to stop the timer in a nice way at the end.

I think I should use the `Shutdowner` interface for that üëçüèª 

Nice one

issue.title: seafile: renew library password - fixes #6662

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this change?

Passwords for encrypted libraries are kept in memory in the server and flushed after an hour.
This PR fixes an issue when the library password expires after 1 hour.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

Yes: fixes #6662 


#### Checklist

- [X] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-new-feature-or-bug-fix).
- [X] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [X] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [X] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [X] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body: The fix for this is merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) in 15-30 minutes and released in v1.62
